tool.name: Inspect_Geodatabase_Schema

param.name: gdb_path
param.dialogReference: The geodatabase whose schema is to be exported.
param.pythonReference: The path to the geodatabase whose schema is to be exported.

param.name: output_directory
param.dialogReference: The directory where the spreadsheets will be created.
param.pythonReference: The path to the directory where the spreadsheets will be created.

param.name: include_index
param.dialogReference: Whether to include an index page and links between spreadsheets in the workbooks.
param.pythonReference: A boolean indicating whether to include an index page and links between spreadsheets in the workbooks.

param.name: include_base_fields
param.dialogReference: Whether to include the base geodatabase fields (OBJECTID, Shape, Shape_Length, and Shape_Area) in the output.
param.pythonReference: A boolean indicating whether to include the base geodatabase fields (OBJECTID, Shape, Shape_Length, and Shape_Area) in the output.

tool.summary:
The Inspect Geodatabase Schema tool reads the schema and metadata of a geodatabase and outputs 3 Excel spreadsheets:

  • Datasets: List of all feature classes and tables in the geodatabase along with their basic properties, fields, and subtypes.

  • Domains: List of all domains in the geodatabase and their properties.

  • Relationships: List of all relationship classes in the geodatabase along with their basic properties, rules, and fields.

This tools will only list out feature class, table, and relationship class dataset items. Other types such as rasters, views, and network datasets will be skipped.

Consts.useLimit: This tool is distributed "AS IS" and is not supported nor certified by Esri Inc. or any of its international distributors. No guarantees are made regarding the functionality and proper functioning of this tool.
